content:
Diagnosis:	Basal cell carcinoma right parietal scalp, T3 with local invasion

Management:	15 Jan 2024 Wide local excision with 1cm margins and local flap reconstruction

Histology:	Infiltrative basal cell carcinoma, clear margins (closest 4mm)

Current situation:	Routine follow-up review

[redacted name] attended for routine follow-up today. The surgical site has healed well with good cosmetic outcome. There is no evidence of local recurrence on examination. The flap shows good vascularity with no areas of concern. Sensory function is intact. She reports occasional mild scalp tenderness but this is improving. No new skin lesions identified on full skin examination. She understands to monitor for any new lumps or non-healing areas. Plan for continued 6-monthly surveillance. Next review due October 2024.
